event: Christopher Columbus reaches the Venezuelan coast during his third voyage
Welser banking family of Germany gains control of the colony under Spanish crown
Caracas established as capital of Province of Venezuela
Venezuela becomes part of the Viceroyalty of New Granada
Venezuelan War of Independence begins with formation of local junta
Venezuela declares independence from Spain
Simón Bolívar helps form Gran Colombia including Venezuela
Venezuela separates from Gran Colombia and becomes independent republic
Dictatorship of Juan Vicente Gómez begins
Death of Gómez; beginning of more democratic reforms
Return to democracy after fall of Pérez Jiménez dictatorship
Oil boom fuels economic prosperity
Caracazo riots erupt over austerity measures
Failed coup attempt by Hugo Chávez
Hugo Chávez elected president, begins Bolivarian Revolution
Brief coup removes Chávez from power; he is restored within days
Chávez dies; Nicolás Maduro becomes president
Opposition wins control of National Assembly
Controversial Constituent Assembly formed, overriding legislature
Juan Guaidó declares himself interim president; major international crisis
Economic and political crisis continues with ongoing sanctions and migration
